item.title: Tutorial: adding a new component to an AngularJS 1.5+ app
item.description: The design and implementation of AngularJS applications has evolved signicantly since the framework hit 1.0 in June, 2012. In the early period, most applications were written with the ng-controller paradigm. A controller was attached to a template, and the template had access to the controller’s $scope. Child controllers would inherit the $scope of parent controllers. But as the community grew and the needs of Single Page Applications matured, the ng-controller paradigm hit a wall.
